alert.note: Alert for Hendry; Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:49PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Collier and southeastern Hendry Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 249 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 10 miles south of Hendry Correctional, or 20 miles southeast of Ave Maria, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hendry Correctional, Big Cypress Seminole Reservation, Big Cypress National Preserve and Sunniland. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
